descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: A comparative overview of the classification and analysis of the major features and structures found across languages of the world. Rather than providing a broad survey of a wide range of issues, the course will present more extended case studies of a few issues. This quarter the course will be concerned with issues involving phrase structure, word order, case systems, and patterns of relativization such as head-external and head-internal relative clauses.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Attendance, Quiz, Homework, and Exams (midterm and final)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: No textbook. All the course materials will be provided electronically.
